business.headline: Reliance to start solar module factory this year: ReportThis year, Reliance Industries will launch its solar module factory, aiming to meet India's clean energy goals by producing 20 GW annually.

World's happiest and unhappiest careers revealed. Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

Covid cases surge in India: Will it trigger a stock market crash?Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex had dropped by over 900 points to 80,681.76, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 266 points at 24,547.45 as of 12:45 pm. The fall in the market comes after days of strong performance.

Walmart to cut 1,500 jobs in restructuring move: ReportThe job cuts will affect several areas, including Walmart's global tech team, the e-commerce section in US stores, and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.

EPFO adds 14.58 lakh members in March. Women and youth lead the wayMost of the new members who joined EPFO for the first time in March were youngsters. Around 4.45 lakh people in the 18–25 age group signed up in March, making up nearly 59% of all new subscribers. Many in this age group are first-time jobseekers.

Tata Teleservices shares jumps 11% today. What's driving the rally?The trigger behind the rally appears to be growing speculation around a potential capital infusion by Tata Sons Ltd into its struggling telecom subsidiary, Tata Teleservices Ltd (TTSL).

ABFRL demerger: Brokerages assign fair value to new fashion twins. Details hereBrokerages have begun breaking down the newly split entities, laying out distinct growth paths and fair value estimates for both ABFRL and ABLBL.

All ITR forms are out, but you still can't file. What's causing the delay?While all seven ITR forms (ITR-1 to ITR-7) and even the updated ITR-U form are ready, the filing process can't begin until the government activates the utility software. These utilities are essential tools that help taxpayers fill in, check, and submit their returns online or offline.

ABFRL stock drops 66% post demerger. What investors should know The sharp decline from Wednesday's close of Rs 268.95 reflects the market's adjustment for the value of the demerged entity, not a deterioration in Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd's fundamentals.

Who is Vaibhav Taneja? Tesla CFO who made more than Pichai and NadellaWhile Sundar Pichai took home $10.73 million and Satya Nadella received $79.1 million in 2024, Taneja's total earnings far exceeded both.

ITC set to report Q4 results today: Earnings, dividend payout in focusSo far this financial year, the diversified FMCG and cigarette giant has already handed out an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share. Given its track record, investors are now eyeing another generous payout.

Explained: Why bitcoin has hit a fresh all-time high The world's most valuable cryptocurrency has gained over 50% since April, propelled by improving global risk appetite and a flight to alternatives as doubts over the US dollar's stability grow.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Actor Trisha says Thug Life with Kamal Haasan felt like 'safe space'Actor Trisha Krishnan is playing a mysterious role in Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life'. In an interview with India Today, she spoke about working with some of her past collaborators, Mani Ratnam, Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan.

Vijay Sethupathi recalls Anurag Kashyap filming Maharaja climax with injured armAnurag Kashyap was praised for his role in 'Maharaja'. Vijay Sethupathi revealed that Anurag completed the film's tough climax scene despite having a serious shoulder injury.

Emotional Janhvi misses mother Sridevi at 'her favourite holiday spot' CannesActor Janhvi Kapoor recalled visiting Cannes with her late mother Sridevi for their summer holidays. She recently attended the screening of her film 'Homebound' at the international film festival in the French Riviera.

Suniel Shetty says daughter Athiya has quit Bollywood: She is not interestedActor Suniel Shetty recently revealed that his daughter, Athiya Shetty, has quit Bollywood. The actor stated that his daughter has no interest in pursuing her career in the industry.

Actor Amit Sial tears into Anurag Kashyap's remarks on actor's entourage feeActor Amit Sial criticised Anurag Kashyap for his remarks about entourage fees inflating film budgets. He stated that producers need to take a firm stand in such situations and be prepared to handle them.

Do we have one butt or two?: BTS Jin to Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight ShowBTS member Jin recently appeared on 'The Tonight Show starring Jimmy Fallon'. The singer performed the lead single from his latest EP, 'Echo', titled 'Don't Say You Love Me', showcasing his carefree and playful personality.

Mani Ratnam confirms Sanya Malhotra's cameo in Thug Life: It's friendly appearanceSanya Malhotra danced her way into the hearts of people when she appeared in 'Jinguchaa' song from 'Thug Life'. In a recent interview, director Mani Ratnam confirmed that she is doing a cameo in the film.

OG Queen: Internet raves about Aishwarya Rai's sindoor and saree look at CannesAishwarya Rai stole the spotlight at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a stunning Manish Malhotra traditional saree. The festival also saw a strong Indian presence with notable names like Payal Kapadia, Sharmila Tagore, and Neeraj Ghaywan making their mark.

Tom Cruise can now film in space: The only oxygen he needs is adrenalineAt 62, Tom Cruise is still Hollywood's biggest daredevil. From wild stunts to rewriting what's possible on screen, his obsession with pushing limits hasn't slowed down. The only frontier left for him to conquer is space.

Exclusive: Suniel Shetty on stars' silence on Op Sindoor, 'admiring' Shashi TharoorActor Suniel Shetty, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, talked about his admiration for Congress MP Shashi Tharoor. He also answered why a few actors have chosen not to comment on Operation Sindoor.

Kim Kardashian completes law studies without attending collegeKim Kardashian shared her graduation ceremony pictures on her Instagram story, sharing that she has completed law school after six years. She chose to join California's Law Office Study Program instead of attending traditional law school.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 5: Tom Cruise's film eyes Rs 50 crore in IndiaTom Cruise's Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning is cruising steadily at the domestic box office. The high-octane action thriller is expected to cross the Rs 50-crore mark by Thursday.

Katy Perry's witty reply to fan mid-concert for 'texting' her partner Orlando BoomSinger Katy Perry halted her concert mid-way and called out a fan for allegedly sending messages to her partner, Orlando Bloom.

TV actor Dipika Kakar hospitalised due to fever amid tumour surgery delayTV actor Dipika Kakar's husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared an update on his wife Dipika Kakar's health, who was about to undergo tumour resection surgery. He said that she developed an infection as she tried to wean her son, Ruhaan.

Adito Rao Hydari's sindoor-red saree look at Cannes 'melts' husband SiddharthAs Aditi Rao Hydari dazzled at the Cannes Film Festival as a newlywed in a stunning red saree and 'sindoor', her husband, actor Siddharth, couldn't stop gushing over her.

Miley Cyrus recalls 'traumatic' health scare that nearly made her quit musicSinger and actor Miley Cyrus opened up about a painful ovarian cyst rupture in 2023 that nearly made her quit music. Describing the experience as traumatic and excruciating, she shared how difficult it was for her to cope.

Karan Johar says Ishaan Khatter is 'national crush' after The RoyalsKaran Johar and Ishaan Khatter, along with the 'Homebound' team, are at Cannes for the film's screening. Amid all the appreciation that the film received, KJo praised Ishaan and his acting skills.

KJo recalls meeting Leonardo DiCaprio, Martin Scorcese: My knees started rattlingAt the Cannes Film Festival, filmmaker Karan Johar recalled a past encounter with Leonardo DiCaprio and Martin Scorsese. He credited Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan as his lucky charm.

Elle Fanning's Sentimental Value wows Cannes with 15-minute standing ovation'Sentimental Value', starring Elle Fanning and Stellan Skarsgard, received the longest-standing ovation at the 78th Cannes Film Festival, earning a rousing 15-minute applause following its premiere on May 21.

general news.headline: Sindoor, not blood, flows through Modi's veins: PM says Pak will pay for terrorReferring to the April 22 attack, PM Modi said terrorists targeted innocents, singled them out by religion and wiped the sindoor off women's foreheads, and then in retaliation Indian armed forces buried them in the soil.

ED crossing all limits: Supreme Court halts probe into Tamil Nadu liquor scamThe Supreme Court temporarily stayed the Enforcement Directorate's probe into Tamil Nadu's liquor body Tasmac. The order, where it criticised the agency for violating the federal structure, comes following Tamil Nadu's petition to ED's raids.

US was in United States: S Jaishankar on Trump's credit claim on India-Pak truceExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar stated that several countries reached out to India during the four-day conflict. He revealed that the Narendra Modi government had conveyed to all nations, including the US, that Pakistan would need to approach India directly if it sought a ceasefire.

A neck for a neck? Bangladesh's two Chicken Necks that Himanta Sarma has raked upHimanta Sarma put Bangladesh on notice amid Dhaka's growing interest in New Delhi's strategically crucial Chicken's Neck, also known as the Siliguri Corridor.

How India built missile shield to intercept UNSC-member Pakistan's liesSeven teams are headed to seven corners of the world to brief countries on India's Operation Sindoor and justify the shelving of the Indus Waters Treaty. This is why these 32 countries, including Sierra Leone and Panama, were picked for India's diplomatic offensive against Pakistan.

Israeli Embassy staffers shot dead in Washington were soon to be engagedTwo Israeli Embassy staffers, who were shot and killed outside a Jewish museum event in Washington DC, were a young couple about to get engaged.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today?At around 12:51 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 966.37 points at 80,630.26, while the NSE Nifty50 slumped 269 points to 24,544.45. Market volatility spiked, dragging down broader indices and putting pressure on small- and mid-cap stocks.

Wedding gift: DK Shivakumar confirms Ranya Rao's link to minister's trustKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has followed in Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's steps and come out in support of Home Minister G Parameshwara. The support comes amidst the second day of ED raids on institutions linked to Parameshwara.
PM Modi, Sindoor, and a hint of drama. India's Cannes takeover isn't subtleThis year, the Cannes Film Festival wasn't just about movies and red carpet glamour—it had its share of political drama too.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Why Trump's new tax will have Indian professionals in US worriedThe US has proposed a 5% tax on remittances sent to foreign countries by non-citizens. This will be a cause of concern for many Indian professionals working in the US on H-1B and H-2A visas, and even green card holders. But MAGA is asking for higher remittance taxes to make foreign professionals self-deport.

Pak's Rahim Yar Khan airbase lying in ICU: 10 top PM quotes in BikanerPrime Minister Narendra Modi mounted an attack on Pakistan while addressing a rally in Rajasthan's Bikaner and issued a fresh warning, saying if Pakistan continues to export terrorists then it will have to pay a price.

Tom Cruise can now film in space: The only oxygen he needs is adrenalineAt 62, Tom Cruise is still Hollywood's biggest daredevil. From wild stunts to rewriting what's possible on screen, his obsession with pushing limits hasn't slowed down. The only frontier left for him to conquer is space.

How the Golden Temple defied invaders from the northThe Golden Temple hit the headlines after an Army official hinted that air defence guns were deployed in its premises to neutralise aerial threats from Pakistan. However, the Army has denied any such move. In this edition of The Lowdown, we turn back the pages to recall how the Harmandar Sahib, a citadel of faith, has been targeted by invaders who desecrated and destroyed it.

2 terrorists killed in J&K in ongoing operation, 8 neutralised in two weeksThe encounter broke out at around 7 am after the troops of two Para SF, Army's 11RR, 7th Assam rifles and SOG Kishtwar launched a search operation in Singhpora Chatroo.

Kerala reports 182 Covid-19 cases, Health Minister urges cautionKerala reported 182 Covid-19 cases in May, prompting the state to step up precautions as similar surges are seen in South East Asia. Health Minister Veena George urged public vigilance, especially in districts like Kottayam, Ernakulam and Thiruvananthapuram.

US man's review of India's 'worst-rated' airline IndiGo goes viral. Watch videoDuring his IndiGo flight, the man also tried the Chicken Junglee Sandwich and rated it a 7 out of 10, complimenting the fresh bread and moist chicken.

Live: April 22 revenge in 22 minutes, says PM on Op Sindoor at Rajasthan rallyPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday launched a scathing attack on Pakistan, while addressing a rally in Bikaner. He warned Pakistan that India's reply would be even stronger if there were any terror attacks from across the border.

Earlier in the day, PM reached Bikaner and visited the iconic Karni Mata temple. Following his temple visit, he inaugurated the redeveloped Deshnoke Station under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme -- an initiative aimed at redeveloping over 1,300 railway stations across India.

He is set to visit Nal Air Force Station in Bikaner, where he is set to interact with the Armed Forces and boost their morale. His visit comes in the aftermath of India's Operation Sindoor, during which the Nal Air Force Station was targeted by Pakistan, but all attacks were successfully thwarted by India.

After IPL 2025 heroics, Vaibhav Suryavanshi named in India U-19 squad for England tourVaibhav Suryavanshi has been named in India's U-19 squad for the upcoming England tour, starting from June 24. Suryavanshi was the breakout star in this year's IPL.

Jaishankar links Pak Army chief's 'extreme religious outlook' to Pahalgam attackS Jaishankar, speaking to Dutch broadcaster NOS, said the attack in Pahalgam was a 'barbaric' act aimed at crippling tourism in Kashmir and inciting religious discord.

Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

Nepali spy, sleeper cells: Pak ISI's big terror plot before Pahalgam attackDuring the arrest, investigators recovered classified documents and incriminating digital evidence from Nepali-origin ISI agent, Ansarul Mian Ansari. A forensic analysis confirmed these to be confidential military files.

High Commission official who trapped YouTuber a Pakistani spy: SourcesDanish, alias Ehsan-ur-Rehman, who was posted to the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, was expelled by India earlier this month amid tensions with Pakistan.

Covid cases surge in India: Will it trigger a stock market crash?Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex had dropped by over 900 points to 80,681.76, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 266 points at 24,547.45 as of 12:45 pm. The fall in the market comes after days of strong performance.

sports.headline: RCB sign Tim Seifert as Jacob Bethell's replacement ahead of IPL 2025 playoffsRCB bolstered their playoffs squad by roping in experienced New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Tim Seifert, who replaces Jacob Bethell ahead of IPL 2025 knockouts, with the latter returning to England for international duty.

England vs Zimbabwe one-off Test: When and where to watch clash at Trent BridgeEngland are all set to begin their busy summer in Test cricket with a one-off four-day game against Zimbabwe at Trent Bridge, starting from May 22. This is the first time both teams will square off in Tests since 2003.

After IPL 2025 heroics, Vaibhav Suryavanshi named in India U-19 squad for England tourVaibhav Suryavanshi has been named in India's U-19 squad for the upcoming England tour, starting from June 24. Suryavanshi was the breakout star in this year's IPL.

Can you be a replacement vs RCB? Ben Cutting swamped with IPL 2025 fan messagesFormer SRH all-rounder Ben Cutting has revealed that he gets messages from fans, requesting him to be a replacement player for teams who are set to face RCB. Cutting was the star of the show as SRH won the final against RCB in 2016.

DC could not find a settled opening pair: Head coach Badani after MI lossDelhi Capitals coach Hemang Badani blamed their IPL 2025 exit on not finding a settled opening pair. Despite a bright start, instability in the batting order ultimately derailed their push for a playoffs spot.

After horror show against MI, DC's Mukesh Kumar fined for code of conduct breachDC pacer Mukesh Kumar was fined for a code of conduct breach after his poor performance in the loss to MI on Wednesday, May 21. Mukesh's final over proved to be the turning point in the game as Delhi got knocked out of the play-off race.

GT vs LSG Preview: Will confident Gujarat pounce on Lucknow's miseries?GT vs LSG, IPL 2025 Preview: Gujarat Titans aim to seal a top-two finish in IPL 2025 as they face eliminated Lucknow Super Giants in Ahmedabad, with form, depth, and Shubman Gill's captaincy driving their late-season charge.

Mitchell Santner showing his IPL worth in MI colours: Varun Aaron after DC winVarun Aaron feels that Mitchell Santner is finally proving his worth in the IPL after his spell helped MI beat DC. Santner ended with figures of 3 for 11 as MI qualified for the play-offs with a thumping win over Delhi.

Manchester United collapse: A nightmare season ends without glory or europeManchester United's Europa League final loss captured the very essence of their horror 2024-25 season. A campaign filled with missteps, a misfiring forward line and a lack of mentality has seen the Red Devils set for their worst finish in the Premier League and miss out on making it to Europe for the next season.

Hardik Pandya never gives up, good to see his turnaround in IPL 2025: Ajay JadejaIPL 2025: Hardik Pandya soaked in the applause from the Mumbai crowd when he led the lap of honour at the Wankhede Stadium after Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals on Wednesday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Amorim to quit United without payoff if board loses trust after Europa lossRuben Amorim vowed to leave Manchester United without compensation if the board loses faith, following their Europa League final defeat and a disappointing season that has put his future at the club in serious doubt.

GT vs LSG Preview: Will confident Gujarat pounce on Lucknow's miseries?GT vs LSG, IPL 2025 Preview: Gujarat Titans aim to seal a top-two finish in IPL 2025 as they face eliminated Lucknow Super Giants in Ahmedabad, with form, depth, and Shubman Gill's captaincy driving their late-season charge.

Mitchell Santner showing his IPL worth in MI colours: Varun Aaron after DC winVarun Aaron feels that Mitchell Santner is finally proving his worth in the IPL after his spell helped MI beat DC. Santner ended with figures of 3 for 11 as MI qualified for the play-offs with a thumping win over Delhi.

Manchester United collapse: A nightmare season ends without glory or europeManchester United's Europa League final loss captured the very essence of their horror 2024-25 season. A campaign filled with missteps, a misfiring forward line and a lack of mentality has seen the Red Devils set for their worst finish in the Premier League and miss out on making it to Europe for the next season.

Hardik Pandya never gives up, good to see his turnaround in IPL 2025: Ajay JadejaIPL 2025: Hardik Pandya soaked in the applause from the Mumbai crowd when he led the lap of honour at the Wankhede Stadium after Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals on Wednesday to secure their spot in the playoffs.

Amorim to quit United without payoff if board loses trust after Europa lossRuben Amorim vowed to leave Manchester United without compensation if the board loses faith, following their Europa League final defeat and a disappointing season that has put his future at the club in serious doubt.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
